title: Gazebo GUI Position PID controller Integrated term not cleared when world reset

content.raw:
Tested on Ubuntu Bionic with Gazebo 9.4.1


1. Launch Gazebo
1. Insert the model "Simple Arm"
1. Select the inserted model in the render window
1. Drag the bar on the right of the gazebo GUI render window to expose the joint pane
1. For the joint "arm_shoulder_pan_joint" in the Position tab enter a target of 0 with PID gains (0, 10, 0)
1. Pause the world, change the target to 1.5
1. Unpause the world. Wait for the arm to move 45 degrees then pause the world again.
1. set the target position to 0 again. reset the world with `Ctrl + r` and then unpause it

The expected behavior is the model should not move when the world is unpaused because the model is already at the target position (0) and the controllers should be reset with the world. The actual behavior is the model starts moving after world reset, which may be caused by the integrated error not being cleared by the world reset.

  4. Drag the bar on the right of the gazebo GUI render window to expose the joint pane

  6. Pause the world, change the target to 1.5
  7. Unpause the world. Wait for the arm to move 45 degrees then pause the world again.
  8. set the target position to 0 again. reset the world with Ctrl + r and then unpause it

The expected behavior is the model should not move when the world is unpaused because the model is already at the target position (0) and the controllers should be reset with the world.
